generalComment.value:
The data are specific to the Ponzano production site with regard to the weight and characteristics of production inputs and outputs: raw materials, auxiliaries, water, emissions and waste. As far as electricity is concerned, the company is supplied by the national electricity grid and therefore the national energy mix was used (from the Ecoinvent database). However, the consumption data are site-specific. 
Supplier and customer distances were estimated using applications such as Google Maps, again based on actual purchase and sales data. 
For the selected generic data, the following were applied as required by EN 15804+A2, criteria of geographical, technological and system equivalence.
The data quality analysis, carried out according to Annex E of EN 15804, showed a data quality of 'Good' level or better.
The site-specific data cover the year 2021, while for the generic data used for modelling, sources were used that were deemed valid from the respective database in a period no older than ten years from the year to which the site-specific data refer (ergo, valid from 2011 onwards).

In this EPD, powders and resins have been allocated to the different products processed in the plant, including the products under study: 
- data on the electricity consumption of the Polveri plant. 
The Polveri plant, in which produces both powder and resin mixes, has a single meter. Consumption was first allocated between resins and powders on the basis of total kg produced in the plant (sum of Powders, and Resins) and then allocated between the products under study again on the basis of kg produced. Note: for the kg produced for powders, the ten bags per production cycle that are discarded were also counted. 
- the quantity of waste produced concerning the waste attributable to the powder mix production process alone (powder waste) and the resin production process alone (wash water and polymer residue waste), allocated on the basis of the quantities produced (kg). Similar allocation was consequently replicated for waste transport and end-of-life disposal.
- The quantity of waste common to the two processes related to packaging (jar waste, reels, sacks, wood, iron, plastic, nylon), allocated according to the quantities produced (kg). Similar allocation was consequently replicated for waste transport and end-of-life disposal. 
Within the Ponzano site, there is also another production department (Membrane Department). The following consumptions are in common with this department: 
Warehouse electricity: the warehouse shares a meter with the offices. In order to extrapolate the energy consumption only of the warehouse, an energy analysis was carried out to estimate the consumption of the electricity vector on the basis of the uses present there. The figure obtained was then allocated between Amphibia and Powders&Resins based on the area they occupy within the warehouse. An allocation was then made internally between Powders and Resins based on the kg produced.

The cut-off criteria are 1 per cent of the renewable and non-renewable primary energy utilisation and 1 per cent of the total mass input of a unit process. The total input flows disregarded per module, e.g. for modules A1-A3, A4-A5, B1-B5, B6-B7, C1-C4 and module D must be a maximum of 5% of energy and mass utilisation.
A cut-off (<1% by mass) was made regarding:
- Instruction sheet inserted in the packaging
- Label attached to the packaging
For all products under study, the cut-off for the process unit 'Packaging' was <0.5% and <5% for module A3.

technologicalApplicability.value:
This EPD refers to products within VOLTECO's line of repair mortars. These products were created and developed for the purpose of restoring surfaces while guaranteeing the necessary water and moisture resistance performance. PLASTIVO 180 is a two-component, thixotropic and
flexible, which has effective curing properties even at low temperatures and substrates partially wet substrates. It is used to waterproof, under negative/positive hydrostatic pressure, masonry or reinforced concrete surfaces subject to minor settlements and/or movements. The product has obtained the CE marking 1504-2 (European Standard EN 1504 for the protection and repair of concrete structures, Part 2: 'Concrete surface protection systems'). PLASTIVO 180 is sold as a combination of 15 kg Powder component packed in polyethylene bags of polyethylene and 5 kg of Liquid component packed in polypropylene buckets. 
Main raw materials for each of the two components, both in percentage and active ingredient: 
Powder: silica and quartz sands >50%.  
Active ingredient: Blast furnace slag

Liquid: styrene-acrylate aqueous dispersion >50%.
Active ingredient: acrylic resin
